text: On the other hand, those who have financial capability they may start a business otherwise can enter in agricultural practices.
And if s/he has a secondary or higher secondary education s/he can enter job in RMG sector or other industrial job
We are educating ourselves because we wanted to be respected by surrounded society
I am studying because I want to solve problems with my acquired knowledge
I am studying because I want to get a decent job after completing my education
I am studying because I want to manage my life well with my acquired knowledge and this is my target/goal

Education is also necessary for mixing with other people who are educated or officials. Moreover, my family will be depended on me in the future. So, I want to do something for my family if I have necessary education
Dignity and respect come through education. Education makes efficient in communications. Education is needed to become a proper person
To get a good job education is very essential demand
I think men should start an income earning job/activities when they stopped their schooling
Someone have higher education s/he should try to engage a professional job
On the other hand, those who have financial capability they may start a business
I think after stopping studying someone must enter any sort of work. It could be farming, mechanic, driving, whatever it is. He should have skills for specific goal
I want to see our village with all youths obtained higher education. And also having all sort of resources available here
I want see our village is become a child marriage free and all early marriage have stopped in the village.
No one should be deprived of education here
Most men entered to agricultural work

Girls are never stopped their education with their own will rather parents take this decision. And they become a bride after that. Most parents here start thinking for marriage when their daughter promoted to grades eight.
Some also sell their labor during pick season when they are no longer a student
Again, when there is no local agricultural work available some youths go elsewhere e.g. at road construction sites
ome also migrated to XX where they join in factory work (garment and textile).
Thirty to forty percent men migrated to XX  and other large cities for work.
Some men also go to distant city where they pull rickshaw/van with their fellow men.
As much as 40 percent youths migrated to different cities for work. And many of them are already settled and established. Youths are also migrating abroad from our village
keyword: migrated to different cities for work

text: It is fully accepted and appreciated if a young man grows wheat, maize, rice and vegetables in the distant fields or nearby and chickens/ducks at home. Society accepted that men can grow and sell any products whether it is agricultural products or animals.

women can grow vegetables in kitchen garden but she cannot sell herself those products in local market. This is still not possible for her. If there is no man in the household then someone from neighboring family can help her
comments: assuming that mobility constraint is the main reason that a woman cannot sell by herself in the market

text: many people will criticize behind her back and she may lose her social dignity and respect in front of society if she freely moves in the field and public places. Moreover, there might be embargos from own family and lineage.
Adam will tell Ana that he may go to market for selling vegetables but he will not allow her going to market.
keyword: he will not allow her going to market

text: The vegetable must be sold by David it is not possible for Diana. Man can go to market but women are not allowed to go to market and sell products here
keyword: not allowed to go to market

text: There are social hindrances on women’s movement in public places. People will tease and make fun of her work. That will reduce her social dignity as well
Women’s freedom of movement in rural area is an important conditions that limiting to go to market. For this reason, Diana herself could not sell her vegetable in the local market
Young women cannot move alone here because there are social restrictions and respected families do not allow their daughters’ free movement as well
keyword: not allow their daughters’ free movement

text: A young woman is supervised by natal families before her marriage and those responsibilities shifted to husband and his family after marriage. Later she has to depend on her husband’s decision
It is not possible for a married young women move alone. She has to go to market with her husband. She must accompany someone in absence of husband.
A woman can’t move alone to the local market

There will be problems socially. She could be teased, harassed by men in the market. 
This is not possible for woman here
Most women cannot move freely here
The young and older women can walk to the local market but there is always been checked her necessities. This is not comfortable for them move alone there
keyword: not comfortable for them to move alone

text: Young women can go to local market if she needs photographs. And to visit doctor but someone must accompany her.
She should move as advised by her husband and permission. Without this she cannot move to market or other place as well
keyword: advised by her husband and permission

text: Very little, if her necessity is very urgent then she is allowed
keyword: if her necessity is very urgent

text: Older or mother aged woman may go alone but others cannot go alone without an accepted reason
I think what I observed; young women are visiting local market alone nowadays. They don’t give a damn now but women did not show their desire to move alone before. But this has been changing here

Yes, there are social norms which regulate the various works and gender responsibilities. Women have to start some household works e.g. cleaning house premises, wash all utensils, clean the cowshed and cook foods and serve to all family members.  These are all done by women. No men or boys not familiar or habituate to do these works. These are treated as feminine works.
collecting fodder for cows, ploughing lands, transplanting, weeding, sowing, harvesting etc. is men’s work. And carrying loads from field, selling agricultural products in market are also men’s work.
Caring and raising chickens, duck and cultivating vegetables in the kitchen garden are task of woman
For social reasons, women cannot participate in practical agricultural activities and official training
keyword: women cannot participate in practical agricultural activities

text: Women work in the field is not a regular practice in our village. Sometimes they assist to their husbands in crop fields but this is not common accepted practice here.
keyword: women work in the field is not regular practice

text: Social restrictions are for women not for men. So, men can grow and sell any products in nearby or distant market there is no prohibition for his activities
But women practically work and assist husband in the crop fields nowadays but it was not possible before.
keyword: women practically work in crop fields

text: Since Ana is not allowed by her husband so, she has time to help
But Adam may ask less help if she is earning better working at home. Adam will encourage her if she is bringing more money and enhance their household well-being
And if her income is same or reduced then he may tell her to stop her work and join with him.
keyword: if her income is same or reduced

text: Adam can also join with his wife’s activities if he finds it more profitable and prosperous
Mark will be delighted as she is successful in her initiative. We think Mark is surely a lazy husband. So, his reaction will be a positive one to her initiatives.
It is mentionable that almost all the cultivable lands and homesteads are entitled to men in our village
It will be difficult for Diana because a woman cannot establish her plan without her husband’s permission. If Diana goes ahead with her plan there will be clash between husband and wife
There is a chance to breakdown their marriage.  David may divorce her if she does not accept his plan

There will be huge clash and quarrel between David and Diana if she goes ahead without giving much attention and consultation with David. The husband and wife’s accords could be damaged a lot for this
This would be neither easy nor difficult for David because he may inform Diana but it is not compulsory for him.  He is inheriting from his own family and he can do whatever he likes with that money
keyword: he can do whatever he likes

text: There is no separate decision maker for men’s and women’s land in one household. Land may be owned by both husband and wife but all lands are supervised by husband
keyword: owned by both husband and wife but all lands are supervised by husband

text: no social restrictions for men to work women’s lands. Other family members work on women’s land too. Similarly, women also work to her husbands’ lands
This will be neither easy not difficult for Diana because she is going to purchase a land which will increase income further. But on the other hand, friends of David may influence him on his plan.
keyword: friends of David may influence him

text: The plan of Diana and her argument is not bad one. So, if David dismisses her plan outright then there would be a huge clash between them
keyword: her argument is not a bad one

text: This will be neither easy not difficult for Diana because she is going to purchase a land which will increase income further. The society will support her

What Diana is proposing which is also very positive and essential for family in the eyes of the local society (samajer chokhe). So, there is a social power with Diana which is not easy to dismiss for David
female youths do not have opportunity to get new or old agricultural training and livestock related training due to the local norms or customs
keyword: female youths do not have opportunity to get training

text: Moreover, women cannot take additional advantages compare to men. This is not possible and cannot be possible here
For social reasons, women cannot participate in practical agricultural activities and official training
Families do not allow here. But older women from all social groups may participate in farmers’ association and trainings
keyword: older women may participate in trainings

text: Women and female youths could have joined such training if it does conducted by female personnel

All FGD participants agreed that Adam will accept Ana’s joining a local women’s group. There is no contradiction in her joining because she is a vegetable grower like other women. The participants think this joining is positive for her work. She may get new ideas or training which will enrich vegetable cultivation.
many people will criticize behind her back and she may lose her social dignity and respect in front of society if she freely moves in the field and public places.
Mary has fewer social position and dignity in the village because she goes to the local market where she sells her products. She may be lost respect (somman harabe) and reputation

Mark is also losing his social status and dignity in the village. His friends make jokes about him and his reputation will be in stake. Many friends may not say their bad comments in front of him but behind him they will do so. He must lose his respects (somman harabe) from others
Mark will be delighted as she is successful in her initiative. We think Mark is surely a lazy husband. So, his reaction will be a positive one to her initiatives.
There are social hindrances on women’s movement in public places. People will tease and make fun of her work. That will reduce her social dignity as well

There will be problems socially. She could be teased, harassed by men in the market. 
This is not possible for woman here
There is one norm here that is decided by father the head of the household
keyword: decided by father head of household

text: Usually older son may take decision consulting with mother if father is dead or absent.
Most plots are cultivated and supervised by men whether those plots are owned by men or women.
In case of husband’s absence, women can looks after crops and take major decisions herself. She may consult other family members or good farmers in the village.
keyword: In case of husband’s absence, women  take major decisions

text: a good husband consults with his wife and neighbours as well when he is going to plant a new crop variety or use a new technology
keyword: good husband consults with his wife

text: Woman shall talk to her husband if he is still alive. And if her husband already died then she will consults with her in-laws and other neighbors.
keyword: Woman shall talk to her husband

text: I realize that the decision may make by David but he has to take this decision jointly
They will first consult the necessity for home and then take decision for sell. It is not possible for Diana alone
it will depend on their personal relationship. David will pay attention to the whole story of requirements and process of the cultivation from Diana if their understanding is good
David may be accepted Diana’s proposal because there is prospect for better yield and income. So, they will try it for additional income. There will be no problem
I think Diana will take decision because she knows how much keep for consumption and how much to send for sell
Equality is good in some extent but not at all respects
Islam religion allows equality between man and woman but our society does not accept it
Women have to maintain their seclusions (purdah) first then they can do everything
When a husband gives rights to his wife and his wife does the same that is equality.
Equality means if a man goes one place and when a woman is also allowed there that is equality
Both man and woman have same rights and enjoy the same.  A man can do a certain things and similarly if she also can do the same

It is highly essential for a household’s progress. When there is no such relationship between husband and wife then quarrels and clash prevails. But if there is good understanding and respect for each other, sharing everything they can go ahead smoothly
All members of our village must be aware about planed family and ensure rights for all
